intro: Phyllorkis micropetala, commonly known as the small-leaved phyllorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It produces small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Phyllorkis micropetala is typically found in heathlands and dry forests, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
